attributes.action: Support the right of children to have an ongoing relationship with grandparents
attributes.background: More than a million children in the UK today do not have any contact with their grandparents as a result of death, divorce, adoption or foster care. Research shows that almost 50% of grandparents never see their grandchildren again after parental separation or a family dispute.
attributes.additional_details:
Studies show that association and contact between children and grandparents provides a special unconditional love and nurturing which is beneficial and healthy for those children. This attachment is strong and contributes to a child’s sense of self and can be a significantly important relationship in their life. There is also a “vital connection” between grandparents and grandchildren and grandparents provide an important influence on grandchildren’s’ lives.1
1.	Kornhaber A, Woodward KL (1981).

attributes.action: Make PIP standard for cystic Fibrosis
attributes.background:
Cystic fibrosis is an inherited condition in which the lungs and digestive system can become clogged with thick, sticky mucus.
It can cause problems with breathing and digestion from a young age. Over many years, the lungs become increasingly damaged and may eventually stop working properly.
attributes.additional_details:
Most cases of cystic fibrosis in the UK are now identified through screening tests carried out soon after birth. It's estimated that 1 in every 2,500 babies born in the UK has cystic fibrosis.
A number of treatments are available to help reduce the problems caused by the condition, but unfortunately average life expectancy is reduced for people who have it. Extra stress also doesn't help.

attributes.action: Source funding to complete the International Bomber Command Centre
attributes.background: The government is committed to donate £20M to a memorial to the Normandy Campaign from the Libor fund, which is considered a fitting tribute. We request a similar donation, estimated at £3m, be debated in Parliament to be made, to enable the new International Bomber Command Centre to be completed.
attributes.additional_details:
The International Bomber Command Centre (IBCC) is being created to provide a world-class facility to serve as a point for recognition, remembrance and reconciliation for Bomber Command. 
The project includes recording, preserving and relating the stories of all those involved with or impacted by Bomber Command during the Second World War.  Covering the contribution of the men and women from over 60 nations, at all levels, the project will bring to life not only the period of the War, but the fight to gain recognition and the work undertaken to rebuild Europe's cities

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Landlord to discriminate against people on Housing Benefits
attributes.background: Most private landlords, letting agancies and even mortgage companies stipulate in their terms and conditions, that the house can not be rented to anyone on benefits.  With very low stock of social housing this has created a housing crisis for poorer people and families.
attributes.additional_details: This is discrimination against a group of people,  based on an assumption of negative traits and should be declared illegal.

attributes.action: Affordable Clear Citizenship Path for all who earned Permanent Leave to Remain.
attributes.background: This is vital in the context of Brexit as it would remove the threat of unjust deportation from many long term resident from the EU and is recommended in report by the All-Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) on Social Integration Integration http://www.socialintegrationappg.org.uk/reports
attributes.additional_details:
The report by the All-Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) on Social Integration recommends "reducing the naturalisation
fees, which have recently spiralled to just under £1,200—almost ten times the cost to the Home Office of processing the application, and over six times more than the cost in countries such as Germany and Canada" and providing a clear guided path to citizenship for all long term residents from other countries including those from other EU countries.

attributes.action: Provide mental health support for all parents of premature and sick babies in UK
attributes.background:
90,253 premature and sick babies were admitted to a neonatal unit in the UK. [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit, 2014 report]
Parents of these babies are 10 times more likely to suffer post-natal depression.
41% of neonatal units have no access to trained support; 30% no support at all.
attributes.additional_details:
Little Miracles UK are campaigning to see: 

(1) Funding/resources for mental health support for all neonatal units in the UK 
(2) Mental health screening for all parents of premature and sick babies. 
(3) A trained mental health worker e.g. a counsellor, assigned to all neonatal units 
(4) After leaving hospital; care and professional support for as long as it is needed 
(5) Provision for peer-to-peer support, or similar, for these parents

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory self-defence classes into UK secondary schools
attributes.background: I propose that the UK Government introduces mandatory self-defence classes, or a self-defence programme, into the Physical Education (P.E.) part of the curriculum in secondary schools to equip children with the skills they need to defend themselves against an attacker.
attributes.additional_details: Children of today are regularly facing the threat of assault in a range of scenarios from bullying within schools to street abductions. I feel it is incredibly important to start equipping children with key self-defence skills in order to defend themselves against an attack effectively – without putting themselves in further danger. UK self-defence law should be taught as part of any self-defence classes or programmes introduced into schools; to prevent self-defence being used inappropriately.

attributes.action: Grant 1 year post-study internship stay for international students.
attributes.background: Capacity of international students to develop their countries is limited due to lack of internship opportunities. Increasing post-study stay to 1 year which was reduced from 2 years to 4months in 2012, will benefit developing countries as international graduates can return with better experience.

In the face of ongoing global challenges,  developing future generations of leaders is crucial. 
This can be achieved by allowing international students in UK a stay up to 1 year post-study to seek internship placement and gained practical knowledge. Evidence has shown that on-the-job training provides better learning outcomes (Ellstrom,2014)

It was decided to amputate his leg, after several assessments and x-rays, and Rexie came through this operation well. He adapted to his 3 legs and was able to lead a normal, enjoyable life. His new owner had him pts without the Rescue's knowledge.

attributes.action: To have Epilepsy Awareness Month in the UK in the month of November
attributes.background: This month (November) it is National Epilepsy Awareness Month in the US.  In the UK we only have 8 days a year for Epilepsy Awareness and this clearly is nowhere near enough. I have decided to support the US in their amazing efforts and help raise awareness and funds during the month of November.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK, 600,000 or one in every 103 people has epilepsy. Every day in the UK, 87 people are diagnosed with epilepsy. Only 52 per cent of people with epilepsy in the UK are seizure-free. It is estimated that 70 per cent could be seizure free with the right treatment.  There are more than half a million people with epilepsy in the UK. Around 600 people die each year due to Sudden unexpected death in epilepsy.
